edu.ncsu.csc216.get_outdoors.model

Class Trail

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • edu.ncsu.csc216.get_outdoors.model.Trail
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Trail>

    public class Trail
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.lang.Comparable<Trail>
    A representation of a Trail in the GetOutdoorsManager application. Contains information for the trail's id, name, whether its closed for maintenance, snow amount, distance amount, difficulty, and the list of activities in this trail.
    Author:
    mchoi@ncsu.edu, jballie@ncsu.edu

    • Constructor Detail

      • Trail

        public Trail(java.lang.String trailID,
             java.lang.String trailName,
             SortedArrayList<Activity> activities,
             boolean trailMaintenance,
             double snow,
             double distance,
             Difficulty difficulty)
        The behaviors defined for setter methods apply when constructing an Trail with the given parameters. The constructor should throw an IllegalArgumentException if trailID or trailName are null, the empty string, or string with whitespace only. Leading and trailing whitespace should be trimmed from trailID or trailName prior to assigning to fields. An IllegalArgumentException should also be thrown if distance is negative. An IllegalArgumentException should be thrown if activities or difficulty is null. Observers of Trail are notified of the change.
        Parameters:
        trailID - to set
        trailName - to set
        activities - to set
        trailMaintenance - to set
        snow - to set
        distance - to set
        difficulty - to set

    • Method Detail

      • setActivities

        public void setActivities(SortedArrayList<Activity> activities)
        An IllegalArgumentException should be thrown if activities is null. The activities field is set, and Observers of `Park` Trail are notified of the change.
        Parameters:
        activities - to set

        trailMaintenance - to set

      • setSnow

        public void setSnow(double snow)
        The snow field is set; if snow parameter is negative, the field is set to zero. Observers of `Park` Trail are notified of the change.
        Parameters:
        snow - to set

      • addSnow

        public double addSnow(double snowfall)
        The snowfall is added to snow field; if this results in a negative value, the snow field is set to zero. The updated value of snow is returned. Observers of `Park` Trail are notified of the change.
        Parameters:
        snowfall - to add to snow field
        Returns:
        double updated value of snow

      • setDistance

        public void setDistance(double distance)
        An IllegalArgumentException should be thrown if distance is negative. The distance field is set, and Observers of `Park` Trail are notified of the change.
        Parameters:
        distance - to set

      • trailOpen

        public boolean trailOpen(Activity activity)
        Returns whether based on maintenance and snow level the trail is open for the given activity. [Recall from Part 1: If snow is required for the activity, the snow boundary is the minimum number of inches of snow needed in order to do the activity. If snow is not required for the activity, the snow boundary is the maximum number of inches of snow before people are no longer able to do the activity.] Returns false, if activity is not allowed on the trail.
        Parameters:
        activity - to see if the trail is open for
        Returns:
        true if trail is open for this activity

      • allow

        public boolean allow(Activity activity)
        Returns whether activity is allowed on this trail. This method does NOT say that based on maintenance and snow level the trail is currently open.
        Parameters:
        activity - to see if it's allowed on this trail
        Returns:
        true if this activity is allowed on this trail

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        HashCode method for this class.
        Overrides:

        Returns:

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Two Trail objects are considered the same if their trailNames are an exact match. The match is case-sensitive.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - to compare
        Returns:
        true if objects are equal to each other

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        The string representation of an Activity is the trailName, closedForMaintenance, snow, distance, difficult and activities fields separated by tabs. (trailName\tclosedForMaintenance\tsnow\tdistance\tdifficulty\tactivities where activities is a string of activities separated by tabs)
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representation of an Activity

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Trail trail)
        Two Trail objects are compared on their trailNames. Delegate to the String’s compareTo method.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Trail>
        Parameters:
        trail - to compare
        Returns:
        int the difference
